casebody.data:
Maria Beecham HILL, Appellant,
v.
WHMD NEUROSURGERY, LLC, and William F. Hoffman, M.D., Respondents. No. ED 106331 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION ONE. FILED: February 5, 2019
Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied March 12, 2019 FOR APPELLANT: Donald L. Schlapprizzi, One Metropolitan Square, Suite 2430, St. Louis, Missouri 63102. For Respondent: James P. Reinert, Timothy F. McCurdy, 222 South Central Avenue, Suite 500, St. Louis, Missouri 63105. Before Roy L. Richter, P.J., Robert M. Clayton III, J., and Angela T. Quigless, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM

Plaintiff Maria Beecham Hill ("Plaintiff") appeals from the trial court's judgment in favor of Defendants William F. Hoffman, M.D. and WHMD Neurosurgery, LLC ("Defendants"), in a medical malpractice action arising out of an injury that occurred during surgery.

We have reviewed the briefs of the parties and the record on appeal and find no error of law. No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order.

The judgment is affirmed pursuant to Rule 84.16(b).
